facts.text: Maharaja Sris Chandra Nandy owns premises No. 374 Upper Chitpur Road, Calcutta.

By Indenture of lease dated April 27, 1931, Maharaja demised premises to Madan Gopal Daga for 51 years from May 1, 1931, at monthly rent Rs. 1,083-5-3. Sub-clause 6 of clause 2 prohibited assignment without lessor's written consent, not to be unreasonably withheld for respectable or responsible person. Proviso for re-entry for non-payment of rent or breach.
On March 25, 1943, Madan Gopal Daga assigned unexpired lease to defendant with lessor's written consent; defendant accepted as lessee.

Agreement arrived at by correspondence between plaintiff and defendant (January 27, 1945 to February 2, 1945) for defendant to assign lease to plaintiff for unexpired term from February 1, 1945, at Rs. 1,80,000 upon terms in correspondence.
On February 21, 1945, defendant wrote to lessor intimating agreement to assign to plaintiff and requesting consent.
On March 5, 1945, lessor replied that lease determined for non-payment of rents; consent could not be entertained.
On March 8, 1945, defendant's solicitors informed plaintiff's solicitors that consent not secured; agreement cancelled as subject to consent.
On March 10, 1945, plaintiff's solicitors replied that agreement not subject to condition; lessor could not unreasonably refuse consent to respectable person like plaintiff.
Further correspondence followed with each maintaining position.
On March 17, 1945, lessor filed Suit No. 425 of 1945 against defendant for recovery of premises on ground lease determined.
On July 4, 1945, plaintiff filed suit for specific performance against defendant (Suit No. 1031 of 1945).
On July 13, 1945, lessor's ejectment suit settled; defendant consented to decree for Rs. 59,213-11-0 arrears, paid; forfeiture waived, lease revived.
On August 6, 1945, defendant applied to lessor for consent to assignment; lessor declined without reason.
Suit heard partly November 1946, adjourned; disposed January 24, 1947 by Ormond J. decreeing specific performance; if consent not obtained in fortnight, assignment without consent.
Defendant appealed (Appeal No. 21 of 1947); High Court (Harries C.J. and Mukherjea J.) on May 30, 1948 dismissed appeal, confirmed decree with modifications; examined Maharaja on commission.
Decree amended to allow plaintiff set off rents payable from February 1, 1945 till conveyance less outgoings and interest at 4% on purchase price.

legal_issues.text: Whether the agreement was contingent on obtaining lessor's consent, or if consent was a term of the agreement binding on defendant.
Legal incidents of covenant not to assign without consent, not unreasonably withheld for respectable person; whether words qualify lessee's covenant, relieving burden if unreasonably withheld.
Whether plaintiff could raise at trial that lessor unreasonably withheld consent, despite plaint insisting on obtaining consent.
Whether evidence of lessor could be taken in appeal without lessor as party.
Whether appeal court could allow further evidence of Maharaja under Order XLI rule 27 CPC.
Whether term to obtain consent was for benefit of plaintiff only, waivable by plaintiff.
Whether decreeing specific performance exposes defendant to damages for breach of covenant.

petitioner_arguments.text: Agreement subject to lessor's consent; no effective agreement as consent not obtained; no specific performance.
Plaintiff's plaint insisted on obtaining consent; new case of unreasonable withholding not permitted at hearing.
Point of unreasonable withholding could not be raised without lessor as party.
Appeal court should not have allowed further evidence of Maharaja.
Term to obtain consent not for plaintiff's sole benefit; defendant not bound if not obtained.
Specific performance exposes defendant to damages for breach of covenant.

respondent_arguments.text: Agreement not subject to consent condition; defendant bound to obtain consent as term of agreement.
Plaintiff respectable/responsible; lessor unreasonably withheld consent, relieving defendant's covenant burden.

court_reasoning.text: Analysis of correspondence: Defendant's Jan 28 letter counter-offer conditional on acceptance by Jan 30 and consent by early Feb; plaintiff's Jan 29 fresh offer with defendant to obtain consent as term; defendant's Feb 1 acceptance with reservation, plaintiff's Feb 2 unconditional acceptance; agreement concluded, not contingent on consent.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Obligation to obtain consent cast on defendant as term of agreement.

court_reasoning.text: Covenant words qualify lessee's obligation; unreasonable withholding relieves lessee of burden.
No surprise; point indicated in plaint para 11; relied on admitted facts.
Court to decide for specific performance relief; not binding on lessor but necessary between parties.
Appeal court required evidence to clear matter under Order XLI r.27 CPC; discretion proper.
Term introduced by plaintiff; for plaintiff's benefit, waivable; absence defect in title plaintiff accepts.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Defendant cannot plead absence to avoid performance.

court_reasoning.text: Defendant did not make obligation conditional on consent; damages problematic as plaintiff respectable with means; may be why defendant agreed unconditionally.

holdings.text: Agreement not contingent on lessor's consent; defendant bound to assign.
Lessor's unreasonable withholding relieves defendant of covenant; assignment valid without consent.
Plaintiff entitled to specific performance without consent.

precedents_cited.case_name: Judicial decisions on legal incidents of covenant
precedents_cited.relevance: Legal incidents of covenant not to assign without consent, not unreasonably withheld.

statutes_cited.name: Code of Civil Procedure
statutes_cited.relevance: Permits appeal court to take evidence to clear matter for proper decision.

outcome.summary: Supreme Court dismissed defendant's appeal, upheld High Court decree for specific performance of agreement to assign lease without need for lessor's consent, as agreement not contingent on consent and lessor unreasonably withheld it.
outcome.relief_granted: Specific performance of assignment from February 1, 1945; set off of rents less outgoings and interest.

key_quotes.text: "such consent, however, not to be unreasonably withheld in the case of respectable or responsible person"
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Key lease clause qualifying assignment covenant.

key_quotes.text: "This agreement was not, for its coming into being, contingent or conditional on the obtaining of the lessor's consent."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "those words limit or qualify the lessee's covenant not to assign the demised premises without the consent in writing of the lessor."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Explains effect of 'not unreasonably withheld' clause.
